The Schwarzman Scholars Program is presently receiving applications from highly qualified candidates worldwide, with the objective of identifying the most promising young leaders. The selection process for Schwarzman Scholars is highly competitive, drawing from a global pool of exceptional candidates who exhibit academic excellence, outstanding leadership skills, and exceptional accomplishments in their field.

Scholarship Sponsor(s): Schwarzman Scholars.

Host Institution(s): Schwarzman Scholars, China.

Scholarship Worth: Fully-funded.

Number of Awards: Several.

Study Level: Masters.

Nationality: International Students.

About Schwarzman Scholars Program for International Masters Students

Schwarzman Scholars’ community of global leaders embodies the world’s diversity, vitality, and potential. Scholars are committed to expanding their knowledge of diverse cultures, viewpoints, and beliefs. To meet the program’s rigorous standards, successful applicants must demonstrate exceptional proficiency in the following domains:

  • Leadership Abilities
  • Exemplary Character & Integrity
  • Academic Aptitude & Intellectual Ability
  • Empathy & Intercultural Competency
  • Open Mindedness
  • Entrepreneurial Spirit

Schwarzman Scholars program unites a varied group of emerging leaders from all corners of the globe and different industries. Despite their differences, Scholars collaborate towards a shared objective while appreciating and celebrating each other’s unique perspectives.

Eligibility Criteria

To be eligibility for Schwarzman Scholars Program for International Masters Students, applicants are expected to meet the following conditions:

  • Applicants must be international students
  • Applicants must have an undergraduate degree or currently enrolled in undergraduate degree programs must be on track to successfully complete all degree requirements before August 1 of their Schwarzman Scholars enrolment year
  • Must be 18-28 years of age: Candidates must be at least 18 but not yet 29 years of age as of August 1 of their Schwarzman Scholars enrolment year (for the Class of 2024-2025, as of August 1, 2024)
  • Applicants must be proficient in the English language.

How to Apply

To apply, complete the online application by answering all mandatory questions and submitting it electronically. The application form must be completed in English. You may take breaks while filling out the application and resume at any time; the system saves your progress automatically, allowing you to complete the application in several sessions before submission.

Application Deadline

The last day to apply for this scholarship is September 19, 2024
